servinfo.title: Precautions on Replenishing Compressor Oil
servinfo.ptxt: When replacing air conditioning parts with new ones, it is necessary to replenish oil by the amount supposedly remaining in each part.

servinfosub.title: When Charging Refrigerant Only
servinfosub.ptxt: When charging refrigerant without replacing any component, replenish the same amount of measured oil when recovering refrigerant (if not measure, replenish 20 cm³ (20 cc) oil).

servinfosub.title: When Replacing Compressor

attention2.ptxt: Be sure to use specified compressor oil or an equivalent compressor oil.

servinfosub.ptxt: Compressor oil is sealed in each new compressor (1) by the amount required for air conditioner cycle. Therefore, when using a new compressor for replacement, drain oil from it by the amount calculated as follows.

ptxt.emph: “C”: Amount of oil to be drained
“A”: Amount of oil sealed in a new compressor
“B”: Amount of oil remaining in removed compressor

attention3.ptxt: Compressor assembly supplied from factory is filled up with the following amount of oil.

spec.title: Amount of oil in new compressor
spec.ptxt: J20 and F9Q engine model: 150 (+20, –0) cm³ (150 (+20, –0) cc)

spec.title: Amount of compressor oil to be replenished after part replacement
spec.ptxt: Condenser for M16 engine model: 30 cm³ (30 cc)
Condenser for J20 engine model: 30 cm³ (30 cc)
Condenser for F9Q engine model: 30 cm³ (30 cc)
Receiver/dryer for M16 engine model: 10 cm³ (10 cc)
Receiver/dryer for J20 engine model: 10 cm³ (10 cc)
Receiver/dryer for F9Q engine model: 10 cm³ (10 cc)
